JavaScript: Inheriting names from constructors

Over the course of a project I'm working on I've run into a few really weird JavaScript behaviors. This is one of them. It only happens with theÂ name property, probably because of how names are handled for constructor functions. 
function Foo() {}

// This should be Object.prototype, or {}, or omitted completely,
// but certainly not the Object constructor. Still, what follows
// isn't exactly what you'd expect...
Foo.prototype = Object;

var foo = new Foo();

function Bar() {}

Bar.prototype = foo;

var bar = new Bar();

bar.name = 'hello';

bar.name // 'hello' in chrome, 'Object' in firefox
